description.narrative: Pakistan has ratified of the major human rights treaties: The Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination (CERD ) , all forms of violence against anti-discrimination Convention (CEDAW), Convention on the Rights Of Child (CRC) , Economic, Social a nd Cultural Rights (CESCR , April 2008) , and most recently in July 2011, civil and Political Rights and the Convention on ( CCPR ) and the Convention Against Torture (CAT) . Public awareness of human rights is weak, and radical extremist groups? communica tion against human rights is strong. The project aims to publish Nawa -e- Insan magazine about human rights in Sindh and Urdu languages. The publication aims to produce a human rights based, alternative, independet and critical analysis of the prevailing e conomic social and political conditions, and thus to contribute to the human rights awareness, democracy and the rule of law, equitable development , peace and tolerance. The the target audience is broad, ranging from human rights activists and grassroot s actors to the academic world, researchers, students, journalists, lawyers and the general public. The magazine has a circulation of about 6,000 copies. Democratic Commission on Human Development (DCHD) was founded in 1994, and in 1999 it was registered a s independent, secular, non-governmental organization that is focused on grass-roots human rights training and education, and advocacy.www.aghscru.org.pk
